snippet: For years, doctors have faced draconian decreases in their reimbursements, but now Congress could solve this long-festering problem.
abstract: Editorial calls on Congress to approve bipartisan bill that would address flaws in Medicare's formula for paying doctors; argues that while bill is not without problems, and while time will be short after Senate returns from spring break, passage is essential to protect doctors from large reimbursement cuts over next decade and to push them to prioritize quality of care.
lead_paragraph: For years, doctors have faced draconian decreases in their reimbursements, but now Congress could solve this long-festering problem.
